contentrichtext.text: {{See also|List of Italian telephone companies|List of radio stations in Italy|List of television channels in Italy|Internet in Italy}} '''[[Telephone]]s - main lines in use:'''<ref name="CIA">[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/it.html#Comm ''CIA World Fact Book'']</ref> 20.031 million (2008) '''Telephones - mobile cellular:''' <ref name="CIA" /> 88.58 million (2008) '''Telephone system:''' <ref name="CIA" /> modern, well-developed, fast; fully automated telephone, telex, and data services <br>''domestic:'' <ref name="CIA" /> high-capacity cable and microwave radio relay trunks <br>''international:'' <ref name="CIA" /> satellite earth stations - 3 Intelsat (with a total of 5 antennas - 3 for Atlantic Ocean and 2 for Indian Ocean), 1 Inmarsat (Atlantic Ocean region), and NA Eutelsat; 21 submarine cables. '''[[Radio]] broadcast stations:''' <ref name="CIA" /> AM about 100, FM about 4,600, shortwave 9 (1998) '''Radios:''' 50.5 million (1997) '''[[Television]] broadcast stations:''' <ref name="CIA" /> 358 (plus 4,728 repeaters) (1995) '''Televisions:''' 30.5 million (1997) '''[[Internet]] Hosts:''' <ref name="CIA" /> 22.152 million (2009) '''Internet users:''' <ref name="CIA" /> 24.992 million (2008) '''[[Country codes|Country code]] (Top-level domain):''' [[.it]] == References == {{reflist}} {{Telecommunications in Europe}} {{Telecommunications}} {{Italy topics}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Telecommunications In Italy}} [[Category:Telecommunications in Italy| ]] [[Category:Communications in Italy| ]] [[Category:Telecommunications in Europe]] {{Italy-stub}} {{comm-stub}}
